title: CIA Director Called Russia to Make Clear That U.S. Had No Tie to Wagner Rebellion
description: The Biden administration has taken pains to emphasize that it viewed the matter as an internal Russian affair.

title: Paul Rusesabagina Speaks Out on His Captivity in Rwanda
description: In his first interview since his release from prison, the hotelier-turned-dissident spoke about how he was duped by a Rwandan government informant, and his plans to disregard an agreement to stay quiet.

title: Shot to Protect Against Polio and Five Other Diseases Is Approved by Gavi
description: The international vaccine aid group agreed to provide developing countries with a new shot to prevent a global resurgence of the paralyzing virus.

title: Dismissing Rebellion as ‘Minor,’ Kremlin Dismantles Prigozhin’s Empire
description: Foreign Minister Sergei V. Lavrov of Russia warned the Western countries helping Ukraine not to think that the Wagner group’s mutiny had undermined Moscow’s power.

title: France Splits Into Rival Camps Over Police Shooting of a Teenager
description: Society is increasingly divided between a law-and-order faction and those who see racism in a pattern of police killings or mistreatment of minorities.

title: Traveling to France? What You Need to Know About the Protests.
description: Unrest has spread across France in response to the fatal police shooting of a 17-year-old in a Paris suburb. Here’s what to expect.

title: What Russians See: The ‘Demilitarization’ of Ukraine During its Counteroffensive.
description: On Russian state media, the Ukrainian military is portrayed as completely outmatched and dependent on the West.

title: A Timeline of France’s Protests After Police Fatally Shoot a 17-Year-Old
description: Clashes between protesters and police continued in cities across France. “We don’t forget, we don’t forgive,” crowds chanted.

title: Brazil’s Bolsonaro Blocked From Office for Election-Fraud Claims
description: Brazil’s electoral court had enough votes to block former President Jair Bolsonaro from office until 2030 for spreading false claims about voting.

title: In a Mutiny or Coup, the Scramble to Persuade and Pick a Side Is Critical
description: Experts say plotters’ most crucial task is to convince other soldiers and officers that success is assured. Plus, our columnist’s recommendations for reading up on coups, and modern Russia.

title: Polish Authorities Detain Athlete Suspected of Being Russian Spy
description: It was the 14th arrest stemming from the dismantling of what officials say was a plot to sabotage arms shipments to Ukraine.

title: The End of Affirmative Action
description: We’re covering the Supreme Court’s affirmative action ruling, heat in the South and a fast-fashion blunder.

title: Putin Works to Project Image of Control
description: The Russian president has made choreographed public appearances and mingled with crowds in the aftermath of a mercenary leader’s uprising. The fate of a top general remained unknown.

title: Hun Sen’s Facebook Page Goes Dark After Spat with Meta
description: Prime Minister Hun Sen, an avid user of the platform, had vowed to delete his account after Meta’s oversight board said he had used it to threaten political violence.

title: Avdiivka, Ukraine, Is a Ghost Town. But Some Refuse to Leave.
description: Avdiivka, Ukraine, once had a prewar population of about 30,000. By March, only around 1,700 people remained.

title: French Police Won Authority to Shoot at Drivers, but Got ‘No Training Whatsoever’
description: Data showed a spike in fatal shootings like the one that has incited angry protests. Experts say it’s an unintended consequence of a rushed response to terrorism.

title: French Police Won Authority to Shoot at Drivers, but Got ‘No Training Whatsoever’
description: Data showed a spike in fatal shootings like the one that has incited angry protests. Experts say it’s an unintended consequence of a rushed response to terrorism.

title: Ancient Art or Fashion Forward? Both, Says a Top Batik Designer
description: Josephine Komara has redefined a cultural expression that was intricate and lovely but so locked in tradition it bordered on staid. “Tradition is the way we are,” she says. “Modern is the way we think.”

title: Over 600 Arrested in France After Fresh Night of Unrest
description: Protesters set cars on fire and looted stores in cities around the country for the third day in a row after the fatal police shooting of a teenage driver.

title: Protecting Australia’s Most Charismatic Murder-Bird
description: Cassowaries play a critical role in the Australian ecosystem.

title: Your Friday Briefing
description: A blow to affirmative action in the U.S.

title: France Police Shooting Presents New Challenge for Macron
description: Protests over the fatal police shooting of a teenager come as President Emmanuel Macron seeks to restore a sense of calm after his pension overhaul ignited turbulence in the streets.
